author: Staff Reporter
text:
Demanding that two persons arrested in the case related to hurling of country made bomb outside the court premises recently be released, relatives staged road block in Erumapalayam here on Friday night. Tension prevailed when one of the accused mothers attempted to self-immolate on the road that was thwarted by the police.

On February 22, a gang hurled the bomb at Chelladurai and John, both history-sheeters, when they were leaving the court premises. The bomb missed the target and hit the wall in which a lawyer was injured. Hasthampatti police registered a case and are on the lookout for the accused. On Wednesday, five persons, Silambarasan, Vignesh, Jeyakumar, Venkatesan and Manikandan surrendered at a court in Tiruvarur and were later lodged at a prison in Tiruchi. The five were produced in the Salem court on Friday and were lodged at Salem Central Prison.

Meanwhile, the police arrested B. Karthick (30) and T. Sivaraman (31) of Kitchipalayam. Stating that the two were not related to the case and police have registered false case against them, over 100 relatives blocked the Erumapalayam Road near Kitchipalayam Police Station on Friday night. A team led by Assistant Commissioner of Police Ravindran asked the relatives to give up their protest. As they failed, the police chased them away. Karthick’s mother Vannakili (58) attempted to self-immolate, but the police prevented it. Inquiry is on.
title: Relatives block road demanding release of arrested persons
